title: homework2
text:
creating vectors pre teatment and post treatment

pre_trt_bp <- c(120, 151, 125, 126, 115, 132, 132, 129, 134, 139, 127, 122, 127, 135, 133, 128, 147, 138, 140, 132)

post_trt_bp <- c(127, 145, 135, 122, 115, 122, 123, 126, 126, 129, 132, 146, 120, 114, 121, 120, 128, 120, 133, 115)

assign names to the vector elements using past function

subjects <- paste("Subject", 1:20, sep = "_")
names(pre_trt_bp) <- names(post_trt_bp) <- subjects 

calculate the change in blood pressure for each patient by subtracting post treatment measurements from pretreatment measurements

diff_bp <- pre_trt_bp - post_trt_bp
diff_bp

 Subject_1  Subject_2  Subject_3  Subject_4  Subject_5  Subject_6  Subject_7 
        -7          6        -10          4          0         10          9 
 Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 Subject_11 Subject_12 Subject_13 Subject_14 
         3          8         10         -5        -24          7         21 
Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 Subject_20 
        12          8         19         18          7         17 


calculate the average decrease in blood pressure across all patients using the mean() function

mean(diff_bp)

[1] 5.65


determine which patients experiences a decrease in blood pressure after treatment(a positive change). use which() function here

diff_bp[diff_bp > 0]

 Subject_2  Subject_4  Subject_6  Subject_7  Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 
         6          4         10          9          3          8         10 
Subject_13 Subject_14 Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 
         7         21         12          8         19         18          7 
Subject_20 
        17 


calculate the average decrease in blood pressure for those where he blood pressure decreased(positive change)

mean(diff_bp[diff_bp > 0])

[1] 10.6

title: homework2
text:
creating vectors pre teatment and post treatment

pre_trt_bp <- c(120, 151, 125, 126, 115, 132, 132, 129, 134, 139, 127, 122, 127, 135, 133, 128, 147, 138, 140, 132)

post_trt_bp <- c(127, 145, 135, 122, 115, 122, 123, 126, 126, 129, 132, 146, 120, 114, 121, 120, 128, 120, 133, 115)

assign names to the vector elements using past function

subjects <- paste("Subject", 1:20, sep = "_")
names(pre_trt_bp) <- names(post_trt_bp) <- subjects 

calculate the change in blood pressure for each patient by subtracting post treatment measurements from pretreatment measurements

diff_bp <- pre_trt_bp - post_trt_bp
diff_bp

 Subject_1  Subject_2  Subject_3  Subject_4  Subject_5  Subject_6  Subject_7 
        -7          6        -10          4          0         10          9 
 Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 Subject_11 Subject_12 Subject_13 Subject_14 
         3          8         10         -5        -24          7         21 
Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 Subject_20 
        12          8         19         18          7         17 


calculate the average decrease in blood pressure across all patients using the mean() function

mean(diff_bp)

[1] 5.65


determine which patients experiences a decrease in blood pressure after treatment(a positive change). use which() function here

diff_bp[diff_bp > 0]

 Subject_2  Subject_4  Subject_6  Subject_7  Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 
         6          4         10          9          3          8         10 
Subject_13 Subject_14 Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 
         7         21         12          8         19         18          7 
Subject_20 
        17 


calculate the average decrease in blood pressure for those where he blood pressure decreased(positive change)

mean(diff_bp[diff_bp > 0])

[1] 10.6

title: homework2
text:
Task 2: Basic Data Frame Practice
create a data frame object with the four columns corresponding to the data above

bp_df <- data.frame(
  patient = subjects, 
  pre_bp = pre_trt_bp, 
  post_bp = post_trt_bp, 
  diff_bp = diff_bp)
bp_df

              patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp
Subject_1   Subject_1    120     127      -7
Subject_2   Subject_2    151     145       6
Subject_3   Subject_3    125     135     -10
Subject_4   Subject_4    126     122       4
Subject_5   Subject_5    115     115       0
Subject_6   Subject_6    132     122      10
Subject_7   Subject_7    132     123       9
Subject_8   Subject_8    129     126       3
Subject_9   Subject_9    134     126       8
Subject_10 Subject_10    139     129      10
Subject_11 Subject_11    127     132      -5
Subject_12 Subject_12    122     146     -24
Subject_13 Subject_13    127     120       7
Subject_14 Subject_14    135     114      21
Subject_15 Subject_15    133     121      12
Subject_16 Subject_16    128     120       8
Subject_17 Subject_17    147     128      19
Subject_18 Subject_18    138     120      18
Subject_19 Subject_19    140     133       7
Subject_20 Subject_20    132     115      17


return only rows of data frame where the diff_bp column is negative. use [] or learn about subset function. dont reference the original vector from part one acess the column of the data frame

bp_df[bp_df$diff_bp < 0, ]

              patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp
Subject_1   Subject_1    120     127      -7
Subject_3   Subject_3    125     135     -10
Subject_11 Subject_11    127     132      -5
Subject_12 Subject_12    122     146     -24


Add a new column to the data frame corresponding to TRUE if the post_bp is less than 120 and false if it is not

bp_df$normal <- bp_df$post_bp < 120

print the data frame nicely to final document

knitr::kable(bp_df)

diff_bp

Task 3: List Practice
creating two vectors with pre bp and post bp for placebo group

pre_bp_placebo <- c(138, 135, 147, 117, 152, 134, 114, 121, 131, 130)
post_bp_placebo <- c(105, 136, 123, 130, 134, 143, 135, 139, 120, 124)

create a new data frame with this data in it that is similar from the data frame in task 2(including new column of true/false)

bp_placebo_df <- data.frame(
  patient = subjects[1:10],
  pre_bp = pre_bp_placebo,
  post_bp = post_bp_placebo)
bp_placebo_df$diff_bp <- bp_placebo_df$pre_bp - bp_placebo_df$post_bp
bp_placebo_df$normal <- bp_placebo_df$post_bp < 120

now create and store a list with the two elements – 1st element treatment and 2nd element placebo

bp_list <- list(treatment = bp_df, placebo = bp_placebo_df)
bp_list

$treatment
              patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp normal
Subject_1   Subject_1    120     127      -7  FALSE
Subject_2   Subject_2    151     145       6  FALSE
Subject_3   Subject_3    125     135     -10  FALSE
Subject_4   Subject_4    126     122       4  FALSE
Subject_5   Subject_5    115     115       0   TRUE
Subject_6   Subject_6    132     122      10  FALSE
Subject_7   Subject_7    132     123       9  FALSE
Subject_8   Subject_8    129     126       3  FALSE
Subject_9   Subject_9    134     126       8  FALSE
Subject_10 Subject_10    139     129      10  FALSE
Subject_11 Subject_11    127     132      -5  FALSE
Subject_12 Subject_12    122     146     -24  FALSE
Subject_13 Subject_13    127     120       7  FALSE
Subject_14 Subject_14    135     114      21   TRUE
Subject_15 Subject_15    133     121      12  FALSE
Subject_16 Subject_16    128     120       8  FALSE
Subject_17 Subject_17    147     128      19  FALSE
Subject_18 Subject_18    138     120      18  FALSE
Subject_19 Subject_19    140     133       7  FALSE
Subject_20 Subject_20    132     115      17   TRUE

title: homework1
text:
notes for creating a website
a .nojekyll doc needs to be created
a _quarto.yml needs to be created
this is markdown just plain text

hashtags used to make headers
ctrl alt i to add a coding block



Call:
    density.default(x = iris$Petal.Width)

Data: iris$Petal.Width (150 obs.);  Bandwidth 'bw' = 0.2518

       x                 y            
 Min.   :-0.6555   Min.   :0.0005219  
 1st Qu.: 0.3222   1st Qu.:0.0830968  
 Median : 1.3000   Median :0.2650517  
 Mean   : 1.3000   Mean   :0.2551522  
 3rd Qu.: 2.2778   3rd Qu.:0.4190136  
 Max.   : 3.2555   Max.   :0.4975026  


#| echo = false hides code in the final document
control shift k to do a quick render

title: homework2

creating vectors pre teatment and post treatment

pre_trt_bp <- c(120, 151, 125, 126, 115, 132, 132, 129, 134, 139, 127, 122, 127, 135, 133, 128, 147, 138, 140, 132)

calculate the change in blood pressure for each patient by subtracting post treatment measurements from pretreatment measurements

diff_bp <- pre_trt_bp - post_trt_bp
diff_bp

Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 Subject_20

diff_bp[diff_bp > 0]
